page.title: 03PLACES OF INTEREST
page.content:
{Midlem}dating back to the 12th century is believed to have been established by the Angles. Kelso Abbey records a mill, a brewhouse and twenty-nine 'husbandlands' (smallholdings) on Abbey lands at Midlem.
{Earthworks}are found at two sites. {1.}S.W. of Kippilaw Mains is the site of Rowchester Fort which is probably of Roman origin. A 130yd sector of the west ditch is still visible and indications are that it enclosed an oval-shaped fort. {2.}At Blackchester Moss there are remains of a pre-historic ridge fort dating from iron-age times.{ { {Habbie Ker's Tree}is the site of a tree used as a gallows by the infamous Habbie Ker who dispensed his own rough justice.
